trans-unit.source: Represents a control that renders text that can be changed by the user.
Controls, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> and those that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl>, provide a text property that can be changed by a page user.
When the text property is changed, an event is raised to notify handlers that the property has changed.
Classes that implement IEditableTextControl must define the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event.

Although the IEditableTextControl interface contains only the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event, it inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl> interface, which defines a <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property.

To implement the IEditableTextControl interface, a control must define the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.IEditableTextControl.TextChanged> event that occurs when the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property changes between posts to the server.

In those classes, the event is raised through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnTextChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox.OnTextChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods.
A class that implements the IEditableTextControl interface could define a similar method for raising the event.
Occurs when the content of the text changes between posts to the server.
The TextChanged event occurs when the <xref:System.Web.UI.ITextControl.Text%2A> property changes between posts to the server.
An implementation of this event can be found in either the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> control.
